availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Albert McCue (Monroe County, Kentucky, saddler and soldier in the 9th and 37th KY)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, saddler and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth Arterburn McCue. Father of Greenup B. McCue, Elizabeth J. McCue, Mary S. McCue, Eliza M. McCue, Louisa T. McCue, Elijah T. McCue, and Elvira H. McCue. Saddler in Monroe County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in Company G 9th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a 2nd Lieutenant from November 26, 1861 to March 5, 1862. Ordered to resign March 5, 1862. Served in Company C 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a 1st Lieutenant from September 26, 1863 to October 15, 1864. Cashiered from the service October 16, 1864.

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 372.
